answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in.There can be many causes of burning pain in lower leg like peripheral neuropathy due to diabetes, Vitamin deficiencies, nerve compression and peripheral vascular diseases.Do you have a history of injury to your legs?This requires further evaluation by a neurologist and also a rheumatologist to rule out joint disorders like arthritis which can cause burning pain in the legs.

question: I have had for several years burning in my left lower leg from right above my left knee to the top of my foot (frontal view)and to a lesser degree on my right lower leg. This normally occurs in the afternoon to evening.  Usually it is gone after sleeping. My circulation is good.  I do take Avalide (Avapro 150mg with 12.5 mg HCTZ) and synthroid 75 mcg daily.  Ialso take several vitamins, COQ10, fish oil, flaxseed, calcium with D, magnesium and sometimes a baby aspirin. Anysuggestions what could be wrong.
title: burning lower legs
